The CHAE certification is the only accounting certification offered by HFTP which is specific to the hospitality industry.
f17ba320-9262-4df7-9268-dd264250b9c2.name: Certified Hospitality Accountant Executive

issuer.summary: issued by Hospitality Financial and Technology Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: The CHAE exam has four sections. The current exam features a more global finance focus, and is based on experiential learning from financial knowledge and skills acquired. Exam questions also focus on financial accounting, managerial accounting, ethics, fraud, internal controls and general questions. Updated features also include an ethics and CHAE policies and procedures section. Candidates must receive a score of 70 percent or better to pass each section of the exam.

Accredited College or University — A transcript of college/university credits must be submitted directly to the Certification Administrator by the college/university. Grades of “C” or better will be accepted for credit. Only courses that have a relationship to the applicant’s job duties, as it relates to the CHAE function, will be counted for the purpose of earning qualification points. A current, valid CPA, CMA or CIA certificate is also acceptable as the equivalent of a bachelor’s degree.

A “Certificate of Experience” must be submitted for each employer included on the exam application. Applicants involved in selling a technology product to the hospitality industry ARE eligible to take the CHAE exam, provided they meet the other qualifying criteria.

4373ca74-295e-4195-8404-2073fafc49f7.description: Benchmarking is an essential tool for any profitability tool chest. This course, the emphasis will be to: characterize the basics of operational benchmarking and the use of key performance indicators (KPIs), illustrate the use of KPIs and indexing in effective benchmarking, assess how benchmarking can provide insight into your hotel's performance, assemble effective competitive sets that will allow for effective analysis of both internal and external competitors.
4373ca74-295e-4195-8404-2073fafc49f7.name: Hospitality Benchmarking Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Hospitality Financial and Technology Professionals

alignments.name: Certificate and CPE Earned
alignments.description: A 90% pass rate must be achieved on assessment in order to earn the certificate.

badge_template_activities.title: Module 1: Basics of Operational Benchmarking Demonstrate the need for operational benchmarking. Outline Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Utilize vertical, horizontal, and ratio analysis to ascertain the financial health of your operation.

Module 2: Meet the KPIs Illustrate the role of KPIs in operational benchmarking. Calculate and apply basic and advanced KPIs that are essential in conducting operational benchmarking. Distinguish how KPIs are affected and require tracking by seasonality, moving averages or when reflected in different formats--i.e. percentage of revenue, Per Available Room (PAR), or Per Occupied Room (POR). Calculate and demonstrate when to use indices in operational benchmarking.

Module 3: My Hotel's P&L Identify and interpret the key measurements in the various hotel operating and undistributed departmental financial schedules. Calculate and evaluate the results of flow-through and flex ratios.

Module 4: Choosing the Proper Competitive (Comp) Set Define a Comp Set. Distinguish between the use of internal versus external Comp Sets. Evaluate the considerations in selecting a sound Comp Set. Illustrate the use of operational benchmarking and the Comp Set in enhancing profitability.

skills.name: Create Analysis In Profitability And Profit Center Accounting
